perturbation.original_text: Upon written notification by the Licensor to the Licensee of noncompliance with the Licensor's quality standards in any material respect, such Licensee shall take appropriate steps, in a commercially reasonable time frame, not to exceed sixty (60) days, to cure such noncompliance.
perturbation.changed_text: Upon written notification by the Licensor to the Licensee of noncompliance with the Licensor's quality standards in any material respect, such Licensee shall take appropriate steps, in a commercially reasonable time frame, not to exceed sixty (60) days, to cure such noncompliance. However, the Licensee's efforts to cure such noncompliance shall not be subject to legal enforcement.
perturbation.explanation: Adding 'However, the Licensee's efforts to cure such noncompliance shall not be subject to legal enforcement' after the original text introduces ambiguity. The Licensee is supposed to cure the noncompliance in a reasonable time frame; however, the second sentence added provides that if the licensee does not cure the noncompliance, there will be no legal enforcement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Enforceability of Contractual Obligations

perturbation.original_text: The Licensee agrees that the business operated by it in connection with the Licensed Mark shall comply with all laws, rules, regulations and requirements of any governmental body in the Territory or elsewhere as may be applicable to the operation, advertising, and promotion of the business and that it shall notify the Licensor of any action that must be taken by the Licensee to comply with such law, rules, regulations or requirements.
perturbation.changed_text: The Licensee agrees that the business operated by it in connection with the Licensed Mark shall comply with all laws, rules, regulations and requirements of any governmental body in the Territory or elsewhere as may be applicable to the operation, advertising, and promotion of the business and that it shall notify the Licensor of any action that must be taken by the Licensee to comply with such law, rules, regulations or requirements. However, this compliance is subject to the Licensee's discretion.
perturbation.explanation: Adding 'However, this compliance is subject to the Licensee's discretion' directly contradicts the initial statement about complying with all applicable laws. While the first part says that the licensee agrees to comply with all applicable laws, the second part provides that the licensee can ultimately determine whether or not they want to comply with the law.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of New York without giving effect to the principles of conflicts of law rules. The parties unconditionally and irrevocably consent to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in the State of New York and waive any objection with respect thereto, for the purpose of any action, suit or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of New York without giving effect to the principles of conflicts of law rules. The parties unconditionally and irrevocably consent to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in the State of New York and waive any objection with respect thereto, for the purpose of any action, suit or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby. However, the jurisdiction for disputes may be determined by mutual agreement of both parties.
perturbation.explanation: Adding 'However, the jurisdiction for disputes may be determined by mutual agreement of both parties' after the original text introduces ambiguity. The original text ensures New York jurisdiction, while the additional text provides that both parties can agree on a different jurisdiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Governing Law and Jurisdiction
